constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: LHA Maximum Height Level: All buildings, structures, and works exceeding 150 metres in height (492.1 feet).
LLA Maximum height level: All buildings, structures, and works exceeding 300 metres in height (984.2 feet)

DMDAAP Designation: Area Action Plan- Area: North East Enfield- Policy: Core policy 40

description: Change of use from Use Class C3 (dwelling house) to Use Class C4 (house in multiple occupation - HMO) including part single-storey, part two-storey side extension and part single-storey, part two-storey rear extension with changes to rear fenestration.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this permission. Reason: To comply with the provisions of S.51 of the Planning & Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:OS Plan 57SW/APH/OSBlock Plan Existing 57SW/PA/BP1Block Plan Proposed 57SW/PA5/BP2Floor Plans 1 - Existing 57SW/PA/E1Floor Plans 2 - Existing 57SW/PA/E2Roof Plan 1 - Existing 57SW/PA/E3Front Elevation - Existing 57SW/PA/E4Rear Elevation - Existing 57SW/PA/E5Side Elevation - Existing 57SW/PA/E6Side Section AA - Existing 57SW/PA/E7Floor Plans 1 - Proposed 57SW/PA6/P1Floor Plans 2 - Proposed 57SW/PA6/P2Roof Plan 1 - Proposed 57SW/PA6/P3Front Elevation - Proposed 57SW/PA6/P4Rear Elevation - Proposed 57SW/PA6/P5Side Elevation - Proposed 57SW/PA6/P6Side Section AA - Proposed 57SW/PA6/P7Kitchens 1 - Proposed 57SW/PA6/P8Kitchens 2 - Proposed 57SW/PA6/P9Kitchens 3 - Proposed 57SW/PA6/P103D Model 1 57SW/PA6/P11Area of Habitat Loss: Figures 1-4Design Statement Ref: PA6 V1 dated May 2025Cover Letter dated 27.05.25Level 3 Flood Risk Assessment dated 04.03.25Drainage Strategy Ref 622 Rev V1 dated March 25Parking Survey dated February 2025Highway Safety Impact FormReason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied by more than five residents at any one time without first obtaining the approval, in writing, of the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To ensure that the future occupation of the building does not adversely affect the adjoining premises/immediate

All new work to the outside of the building must match existing original work in terms of the choice of materials, method of construction and finished appearance. This applies unless differences are shown on the drawings we have approved or are required by conditions to this permission.Reason: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory.

No laundry facilities, including washer / dryers, shall be installed in the bedrooms of the development hereby permitted.Reason: To accord with the stipulations of definition as a House of Multiple Occupation and to protect the amenities of future occupiers.

The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until waste storage and recycling facilities to satisfy the future number of occupiers on site have been provided within the development, in accordance with the Enfield's Household Recycling and Waste Planning Guidance for New Developments (February 2024). Such facilities to be retained permanently thereafter.Reason: In the interests of amenity and the recycling of waste materials in support of the Borough's waste reduction targets.

The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until space has been laid out within the site [in accordance with drawing ref: Floor Plans 1 - Proposed 57SW/PA6/P1] for:o	The provision of 5 long stay cycle parking spaces in an accessible location. The access route design to the store shall comply with the London Cycling Design Standards guidance to enable the bike to enter the store and should be step free and involve no more than 2 doors or gate (excluding the store door).o	Secured  with a British Standard mortice lock or access fob  The approved details shall thereafter be installed and permanently retained for cycle parkingo	Fully enclosed by 4 walls and a roofo	Ability to lock a bicycle to a permanent fixture (e.g. Sheffield stand or wall anchor)  The approved details shall thereafter be installed and permanently retained for cycle parkingReason: To ensure that sufficient provision at all times so that the development does not prejudice the free flow of traffic or the conditions of general safety along the adjacent highway, or the amenities and convenience of existing local residents.
